docs.lead_paragraph: Remember the Golden Age of Bipartisanship? The one that lasted from approximately 11 a.m. on Thursday -- when Senators Max Baucus, Democrat of Montana, and Charles Grassley, Republican of Iowa, released their ''Hiring Incentives to Restore Employment Act'' -- to 4:00 that afternoon, when Senate Majority Leader Harry Reid crumpled it into a small ball, lit it on fire and tossed it in a garbage can?
docs.abstract: On the jobs bill, comity gave way to politics. Should we be upset?
docs.snippet: On the jobs bill, comity gave way to politics. Should we be upset?

docs.lead_paragraph: With some Republicans attacking President Obama's health summit as nothing more than political theater, the White House extended formal invitations to lawmakers on Friday afternoon and promised to post a text of the Democrats' bill online before the Feb. 25 gathering.

headline.main: White House Invites Congressional Leaders to Summit

docs.abstract: The White House extends invitations to senior House and Senate lawmakers to attend the health care summit on Feb. 25.
docs.snippet: The White House extends invitations to senior House and Senate lawmakers to attend the health care summit on Feb. 25.

docs.lead_paragraph: The Virginia House of Delegates on Friday passed legislation intended to shield citizens from any federal requirement that they purchase health insurance. The bill goes to the governor for signing.

headline.main: Virginia Legislature Passes Ban on Insurance Mandate

docs.abstract: The legislature sent to the governor on Friday a measure intended to prevent the federal government from requiring individuals to purchase health insurance.
docs.snippet: The legislature sent to the governor on Friday a measure intended to prevent the federal government from requiring individuals to purchase health insurance.

docs.lead_paragraph: In some of the harshest criticism yet of the effort by Democrats to overhaul the nation's health care system, Representative Tom Price, Republican of Georgia and chairman of the conservative Republican Study Committee, on Friday dismissed President Obama's bipartisan health care session as "simply an attempt by the president to use the White House as a political tool to intimidate his way into a government takeover of health care."

headline.main: Rep. Price Derides Health Care Summit

docs.abstract: A conservative Republican lashes out at Democrats and the upcoming health care summit. But an unwillingness to debate policy carries risks.
docs.snippet: A conservative Republican lashes out at Democrats and the upcoming health care summit. But an unwillingness to debate policy carries risks.

docs.lead_paragraph: A variety of consumer-focused articles appear daily in The New York Times and online in our blogs. Each weekday morning, we gather them together here so you can quickly scan the news that could hit your wallet.
docs.abstract: The federal effort to create new jobs, finding cruise deals and extended weekend getaways and other consumer-focused items from Friday's Times.
docs.snippet: The federal effort to create new jobs, finding cruise deals and extended weekend getaways and other consumer-focused items from Friday's Times.

docs.lead_paragraph: Uwe E. Reinhardt is an economics professor at Princeton.
docs.abstract: President Obama needs to clarify the terms of the health care debate at his meeting with members of Congress, an economist writes.
docs.snippet: President Obama needs to clarify the terms of the health care debate at his meeting with members of Congress, an economist writes.

docs.lead_paragraph: President Obama has failed to bring the third Democratic wave. He needs to redefine what his administration hopes to achieve.
docs.snippet: President Obama has failed to bring the third Democratic wave. He needs to redefine what his administration hopes to achieve.

docs.lead_paragraph: Even as Republicans denounce modest proposals to rein in Medicare’s rising costs, they are seeking to dismantle the whole program.
docs.snippet: Even as Republicans denounce modest proposals to rein in Medicare’s rising costs, they are seeking to dismantle the whole program.

docs.lead_paragraph: With 14.8 million Americans unemployed, the proposal put forth in the Senate to respond to joblessness is so puny as to be meaningless.

headline.main: How Not to Write a Jobs Bill
headline.print_headline: How Not to Write a Jobs Bill

docs.snippet: With 14.8 million Americans unemployed, the proposal put forth in the Senate to respond to joblessness is so puny as to be meaningless.

docs.lead_paragraph: Anthem Blue Cross, a California health insurance company, said that increases of up to 39 percent in premiums were driven by rising health care costs.

headline.main: Administration Rejects Health Insurer’s Defense of Huge Rate Increases
headline.print_headline: Administration Rejects Health Insurer’s Defense of Huge Rate Increases

docs.snippet: Anthem Blue Cross, a California health insurance company, said that increases of up to 39 percent in premiums were driven by rising health care costs.
